author: Robert Summers, Indianapolis Mortgage Examiner
title: Stop Thief: Prevent Burglars from breaking into your home.
text:
Google Plus Play No crime prevention effort will EVER be a sure fire way of preventing a crime. The goal is simply to approach security in a HOLISTIC fashion to harden the target as much as possible from every angle. The Crime Prevention Guy 
Don't welcome a burglar into your home. Most residential burglars devote little if any time to the advance planning of any specific break-in. Their crimes are, for the most part, crime or opportunity. RBS 
They pick what appears to be an easy mark. If their advance checking and closer examination reveal a greater risk than anticipated, they move onto a safer target. 
The more you can do to keep your home from looking like an easy target, the safer you are. There are also many steps that you can take to minimize your loss and improve your chances of recovery if a break-in occur. Excerpt from Tulane University How to Prevent a Residential Burglary 
Did you know that a burglary takes place every 14.4 seconds in the United States that is an alarming number. 
How burglars break in: 34% of burglars enter right through the front door. 23% through first floor windows. 22% through the back door. 9% through the garage. 60% of burglars enter the home by force. 30% of burglars enter the through an unlocked door or window. Scary, 28% of the time someone is at home. 
What are they looking for? 
Jewelry | Electronics | Identification | Office Equipment | Firearms | Tools Cash
